speaker: Dungeon Master & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Magnus Burnsides
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Merle Highchurch
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Taako Taaco
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Episode 45 - The Eleventh Hour - Chapter Five
Griffin
lines: Previously, on The Adventure Zone

speaker: [Recap music begins playing in the background]
The Director
lines: The fifth Grand Relic. The Temporal Chalice [pronounced with a soft “ch” sound]. Or Chalice [pronounced with a hard “ch” sound], depending on just sort of what region you’re from.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: I’ve been falsely accused, boys. I’m locked up here. They said I blew up the temple. I don’t blow up any damn temples, I blow up the earth! I get those diamonds out from under ‘em. Best there ever was, that’s sure as shit true.

speaker: Ren
lines: Oh my god. You—

speaker: Taako
lines: It’s actually Taako.

speaker: Ren
lines: You’re Taako!

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, well it’s always nice to meet a fan.

speaker: Ren
lines: The magical chef, I saw your show in the Underdark!

speaker: Griffin
lines: There is some kind of forcefield. And it’s surrounding the only other door in this room.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Through that hole in the floor, you can see teeth. Both the flame and the purple worm burst through the bubble, and you do not live long enough to hear the 12th chime of the clock above you.

speaker: Announcer
lines: I hope our boys have a very big salt shaker! I don’t actually know if salt kills worms; it’s hard to think of things to say sometimes. The Adventure Zone!

speaker: [Theme music
lines: Déjà Vu by Mort Garson]

speaker: Griffin
lines: So the three of you just died again. Oopsie-doodle.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] What you gonna do, you know?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Every time you do that your K-D ratio goes down a little bit. And there will be leaderboards at the end of the campaign.

speaker: Travis & Justin
lines: Aww man.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Keep an eye on that. You’re not gonna get the fun, um, killshot banners— I haven’t played Call of Duty in a while.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, what kind of achievements have we earned so far in this run?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Not a whole lot, they’re mostly, like, the ones you have to unlock to, like, move through with the story. Most… improved?

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh okay, I’ll take that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you’re back in that white space after dying, and you see the old woman again. She looks exhausted, like she did while you were working your way through the mines sort of trial and error style. But she actually looks kind of pleased with you? And she says,

speaker: Old Woman
lines: You’re getting very close.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Are we hot or cold?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then you fade out and wake up again. And you’re in front of Roswell, and you’re in front of the beautiful village of Refuge like you have woken up in front of just so so many times! World's your oyster.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uhm, quick show of hands poll, even though we’re in an audio medium. Were we all cool with the quick-play of here's all the names and the people and skip this loop?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, I think so. Jump right up to the locker room? I just raised my hand, Justin has his up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, uh, you’re gonna go back to the quarry?

speaker: Travis
lines: No, I just wanna get through the Roswell exchange.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Deep voice] The Roswell Exchange!

speaker: Travis
lines: The Roswell Exchange, as it shall become known, in all the documents.

speaker: Clint
lines: Protecting your investments!

speaker: Justin
lines: [Crosstalk] This is like, five minutes in. Okay, hmm. I was kind of hoping that we would have found a diamond by now.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Because I feel like we need, at least, like a little more guidance. We definitely know what’s destroying the town, but we don’t have the faintest clue what to do about it.

speaker: Travis
lines: I have an inclination to go try to talk to Isaak finally? Because we’ve heard a lot about him but we haven’t met him yet, and I feel like he’s got something to do with those barriers, but I also—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] I will say this, re diamonds, they are the currency in this town. So, it’s not like you have to find them in a mine, in the same way you don’t go to the like, US Treasury to get dollar bills from the printing press.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Deadpan] You want me to get a fucking part-time job? What do you want? [Clint laughs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: I wouldn’t hate that.

speaker: Justin
lines: …Okay, I’m gonna get a part-time job.

speaker: Travis
lines: You do have a strong connection with Ren.

speaker: Justin
lines: Let’s go to— okay, yes, yes, let’s go to Ren.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, I’m gonna go try to find Isaak, are you guys cool splitting the party?

speaker: Clint
lines: I’ve got all the party points, so yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Dad, do you wanna go with Trav, because he may need muscle, and I’m just gonna trick people. Or do you wanna go with me?

speaker: Clint
lines: Aw man, my first big choice. I’m rolling a die. If it’s odd—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, shit! This is your first big choice? We’re playing this game for like 45 episodes!

speaker: Clint
lines: I am, I am— If it’s odd I go with Justin, if it’s even I go with Travis. [Dice roll] It’s even. I go with Travis.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! Taako—

speaker: Travis
lines: I lean into Merle.

speaker: Magnus
lines: We’re just gonna go take a nap!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, Merle and Magnus, I want you to think about how you would find this dude. Because like, you haven’t seen them anywhere. So I don’t know how you plan to accomplish that.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, um.

speaker: Griffin
lines: But we’ll get to that. Taako, we’ll start with you. You’re just rolling up to The Davy Lamp?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yep, I’m headed in The Davy Lamp!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you’re in there, and you’re in there so early that you actually see these two purple kerchief ruffian-looking folks. And, they’re just, they’re drunk. They’re not like, threatening anybody, they’re just kinda drunk and they’re causing a scene.

speaker: And they’re talking about how shitty the bubble is and how they’re gonna pop this thing one way or another, and they got big, big plans. It’s kinda like that scene in Hamilton, “The Story Of Tonight”, only if everybody was like dicks. And they’re just talking about their big plans and their interests and stuff.
Justin
lines: Got it.

speaker: Travis
lines: If everybody was literal wangs.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Ren looks kind of frustrated with these two folks. Otherwise, the scene is just as it was the last time. There’s a piano player playing some smooth-ass jazz jams, the gambler and their—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Did you say jock jams?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, they’re playing jock jams on the piano. [Short silence] And I’m leaving a silence here for what that sounds like. I don’t know if I’ll be able to learn how to play jock jams on the piano. I have 24 hours until this episode goes up.

speaker: [A piano version of jock jams does indeed begin playing]
The gambler and their goliath friend sitting at a table. Yeah, it’s the usual scene.
Taako
lines: Uh, hello madam—

speaker: Ren
lines: Oh my god. You’re Taako!

speaker: Taako
lines: I am. I’m looking for, uh, an—

speaker: Ren
lines: I’m your biggest fan! I saw you play in the Underdark!

speaker: Taako
lines: I… Wait a minute, are you, are you Ren?

speaker: Ren
lines: You remember me!

speaker: Taako
lines: Little Ren? [Clint laughs] Oh, I can’t believe it, I remember you right there in one of the rows! In one of the seats, right?

speaker: Ren
lines: Yeah, Row D.

speaker: Taako
lines: Row D! That’s right!

speaker: Ren
lines: Seat…

speaker: Taako
lines: [Trailing along after Ren’s lead] Seat—

speaker: Ren
lines: Seven…

speaker: Taako
lines: [Drawn out] Seven—

speaker: Ren
lines: —teen!

speaker: Taako
lines: —teen! [Clint laughing] I remember that very well, I love playing the Underdark. How are you?

speaker: Ren
lines: I’m doing okay, except I got a couple of these rowdy boys in here, and they’re trying to really cause a stink.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And one of the rowdy boys says,

speaker: Rowdy Boy
lines: [Drunkenly] Hey, I don’t appreciate that! I’m just trying to tell everybody about my big, bold plans, and— come along! Join the Liberation Brigade!

speaker: Taako
lines: Well, listen, I have some business to discuss with you. Do you need me to get rid of those fellas?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says,

speaker: Ren
lines: No, I think I’ve got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And she pulls out that rod from behind the counter, and the two guys just draw on her kind of sloppily and she blasts them outside of the bar. Over your head, they go flying out of the bar. And they are gone. She blows the gunsmoke off of the rod and puts it back under the counter.

speaker: Taako
lines: There is no way you could have anticipated this, but that is exactly what I came here to see.

speaker: Ren
lines: W-what can I you do for you, Taako? What are you even doing here?

speaker: Taako
lines: Well, I’ll tell you! You remember the cooking show; so that’s sort of on… hiatus. Kind of a revamp we’ve got going right now. And in the interim, I decided that I want to share what I know with the people of the world!  And, honestly, and you’re gonna find this hard to believe, but word of your magics has sort of gotten around. What you did just there? Really nice!

speaker: Ren
lines: Thank you! I’ve been working on that, it’s kind of a new spell I’ve been working on, and it’s called… Jerk Remover! Jerkwad Remover!

speaker: Taako
lines: Jerkwad Remover, yeah, I’m super impressed. Can I be honest with you, though? A little bit frank? Just a touch sloppy. A little bit. And you know this, right? I’m not telling you anything you don’t know. It’s a work in progress, right?

speaker: Ren
lines: Yeah, I mean, it’s— I could have removed those jerkwads I guess a little bit faster, a little bit more efficiently.

speaker: Taako
lines: Well, and there’s other magics, more subtle magics. Here’s what I’m gonna do, here’s what I’m working on right now. I am going from town to town and holding some, hmm, I think you’d call them seminars.

speaker: There are, uh, sort of, they’re called “Help Yourself, Cast Yourself, Into Ma— [Laughter from the others increases] Can I finish? They’re called “Help Yourself, Cast Yourself—”
Ren
lines: [Crosstalk] “Cast Yourself,” yeah—

speaker: Taako
lines: “—Into Magic Legend.”

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s the use of the word cast that makes me think of every [commercial voice] “Have you ever wanted to be a model?”

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, that’s exactly right.

speaker: Ren
lines: You’re talking about HYCYIML [struggles to pronounce it, ends up with “Hi-key-mik-el”]

speaker: Taako
lines: Right. It’s called, yes, that’s what it’s called. I’ll have a better acronym soon. And hopefully you— Next time around I’ll have a better acronym. [Laughter]

speaker: Clint
lines: Let me die once!

speaker: Taako
lines: Let me die, and I’ll, uh, cook something up.

speaker: Ren
lines: Um—

speaker: Taako
lines: But anyway, so, it’s a seminar! It’s a one day thing, and I’m basically— I do it in a town once. But the only sort of hitch is, that I need sort of the payment upfront because I use it to secure venue and all the supplies I’ll need for the class.

speaker: Ren
lines: How much is it? I would pay anything, are you kidding me?

speaker: Taako
lines: Uh. How much— this is a weird question. [Griffin laughing] How much is a diamond? How many is that? Is that good?

speaker: Ren
lines: Uh, when the bubble went up, the trading price was about 300 gold to one ounce. So—

speaker: Taako
lines: Sure… of diamond?

speaker: Ren
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Ditto, remind us. What was Paloma’s rate?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It was one diamond for small prophecy, ten diamonds for big.

speaker: Justin
lines: We can’t introduce weight of diamonds into this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, we’ll say about one diamond is one ounce.

speaker: Taako
lines: One diamond is 300 gold. Okay, so it costs… one diamond. Can you believe it?

speaker: Ren
lines: That ain’t very much at all! Okay, yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: She opens up the till on the counter, and you can actually see this thing is chock-full of diamonds. Like, literally full of diamonds. If someone came in here and gave her diamonds she might actually have a hard time putting them in the till. She fishes one out and flicks it in your direction. And actually, I think that gambler elf, and the goliath, the gambler stands up and says

speaker: Elf
lines: I think I would actually love to get down on this lesson as well. I’m always looking to hone my craft. Can you see multiple people at once?

speaker: Taako
lines: It is best if I do that. Now, how much magic do you know going in?

speaker: Elf
lines: [Laughing] Quite a bit, thank you.

speaker: Taako
lines: Quite a bit, that was not the answer I was hoping for. [Griffin laughs] Listen, the rate’s a little different for you, my friend.

speaker: Elf
lines: Now that doesn’t seem fair at all.

speaker: Taako
lines: I know! I know, but this is the way of magic, the arcane arts are a mysterious haze anyway.

speaker: Clint
lines: You’ll learn that in the seminar!

speaker: Taako
lines: In the seminar you’re gonna hear all about that. It’s, uh, it’ll be nine diamonds!

speaker: Elf
lines: Goodness, okay. Uh—

speaker: Taako
lines: But here’s— here’s the best part! After the seminar— this is mainly to secure my venue and what have you— after the seminar, you get half of that back.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Whispered] Wow!

speaker: Elf
lines: That’s a great deal! Okay. [Clint laughs]

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, it’s a great deal!

speaker: Elf
lines: I’m skeptical but bored.

speaker: Griffin
lines: They said, and you see them flip a part of their poncho to the side, revealing a coin purse. They also have like a badass looking wand in a holster at their side. And they open up that coin purse and hand you a fistful of nine diamonds.

speaker: Taako
lines: Great! Oh, great! This is excellent. Now, listen, this is binding, so everybody has to promise me that you’ll show up tomorrow for the seminar. Does everybody promise?

speaker: Elf
lines: This is a reservation fee then? I’m kind of confused about—

speaker: Taako
lines: Right well, it takes place tomorrow, I wanna use today to get everybody together and we’re gonna start— cause you know, dawn's light and the effect that that has on magics?

speaker: Elf
lines: No, I don’t, I have no idea what you’re talking— will this be covered in the seminar?

speaker: Clint
lines: You’ll learn that in the seminar!

speaker: Taako
lines: Hell yeah it’ll be covered in the seminar! Don’t get uppity now, you haven’t even passed 101!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ren takes out a little day calendar, and like, jots it down and says,

speaker: Ren
lines: I can’t wait! I’m excited already.

speaker: Taako
lines: Great! I do just have to say, my lawyers, this is funny, it’s gonna sound like a joke, but my lawyers have told me to say that if there isn’t a tomorrow this is null and void. But, [laughing] of course there will be a tomorrow! Right?!

speaker: Ren
lines: Yeah, that’s a weird thing to even, hypothetical to even bring up.

speaker: Taako
lines: [Crosstalk] For sure, for sure! So listen, everybody start working on your magics, and I’ll see you bright and early first— let’s meet up here! Tomorrow!

speaker: Ren
lines: Yeah, I mean, I work here, so that’ll be great for me. Oh, and Ash is always here, so, um, that should be great.

speaker: Taako
lines: Great!

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Always here catching ‘em all!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright. So you have ten diamonds, and you did that fairly quickly. We’ll say it’s about 1110 or so. Magnus and Merle, hop over to you, what are you doing? How are you finding this— How are you finding Isaak?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Alright Merle, so I feel like. He’s got this big house, right?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Travis
lines: Character voices.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah?

speaker: Magnus
lines: And we haven’t been there… yet.

speaker: Merle
lines: Right.

speaker: Magnus
lines: So, like, let’s… go there.

speaker: Merle
lines: D’okay!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah! Good planning!

speaker: Merle
lines: On we go!

speaker: Travis
lines: We take off down the road.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You make your way to the elder’s manor. It is a fairly secure looking location, there is a kind of a barbed wire fence going around it. It’s a two story building, one of the only two-story buildings in town, and it looks pretty nice.

speaker: Through that fence, the fence is locked, you can see a big heavy metal door that looks like about the only entrance into the building, aside from some windows on the second story, that is heavily padlocked. It looks extremely secure. There’s actually a few locks on that big heavy metal door. And yeah, this fence is running the perimeter of the building.
Magnus
lines: Merle, do you have any like, “detect life” or like “find person” or “where’s that dude” spells?

speaker: Merle
lines: I have been searching through my vast litany of spells [Griffin chuckles] and I can’t find anything like that anywhere in there. But, I do have a spell called Legend Lore?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay?

speaker: Merle
lines: Where all I do is describe a person and I get a brief summary of knowledge about that person. It can come from forgotten stories or secret lore. Maybe it’ll tell us something about him that’ll help us get in.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Sure, why the fuck not.

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t know, so that would be like for some sort of legendary character in history. I don’t know that that would apply to some dude in a small town that has been removed from time.

speaker: Justin
lines: He’s the most prominent figure in the town, though. There’s no legends or lore about him?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I guess there would be, but it wouldn’t tell you where he is currently. That’s not lore, that’s just like information about where they are.

speaker: Travis
lines: I would say, my keen D&D senses are telling me that we’re not supposed to go into the elder’s manor yet.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I would also remind you that Paloma is literally built into this game for situations where…

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Yeah, but Taako’s taking care of that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Let’s see. He’s not at Helpington’s, he’s not at Davy’s Lamp, he’s not at the bank.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Lemme do something, actually. While you all are checking out the elder’s manor, can you both make perception checks for me?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes. [Dice roll] That’s a one.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jesus.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Dice roll] That’s a seven.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Nothing happens and it’s all good, don’t even worry about it, dawg. [Clint laughs]

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, let me do an investigation check of the manor. That’s something I would do. [Dice roll] That’s a 20.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’ve got no perception, but when I’m trying? I can definitely see stuff.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, that investigation check is so good that I will tell you there’s no lights on in the manor, you put your fucking ear to the ground, there’s no sound coming from the manor. You use the Lens of Straight Creeping, nobody’s come in or out of this manor for a grip of time. It has been a really long time since somebody has been in this building.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Merle, let me ask you a question.

speaker: Merle
lines: [Strong character voice] Fire away!

speaker: Justin
lines: There it is.

speaker: Magnus
lines: There’s a couple different places we haven’t checked out yet. The cave, the fallen temple, Stonefruit Farm…

speaker: Merle
lines: Have we actually been to the clock tower? I mean, we’ve seen it blow up and burn up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s not much to the clock tower. There’s not an inside to the clock tower, I don’t think. It’s just a big, big old clock.

speaker: Merle
lines: We haven’t been to the farm, right?

speaker: Magnus
lines: You know what? Let’s go a different direction.

speaker: Merle
lines: Okay.

speaker: Magnus
lines: We’re gonna go to the sheriff's office.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Merle
lines: Right, where we’ve… been, and he wasn’t there.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, just follow me on this one. Come with me on this one, won’t you?

speaker: Merle
lines: Sure. Lay on, Macduff!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, what are you doing in the sheriff's office. Roswell’s not there, Roswell's at the bank, where you just warned him to be. Warned them to be.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now that we know what’s going on at the mining place, I say we grill the shit out of Cassidy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, they probably pass me on the way and I’m juggling diamonds and, like, shaking my butt at them. [Clint laughs] Like, I’m done.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Taako, what are you gonna go do?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, right, absolutely, see you there! [Griffin laughs]

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay. Let’s finish up this thing, and then we’ll do Taako. Alright, you’re grilling Cassidy?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, you walk in and she just instinctively like,

speaker: Cassidy
lines: [Hollering] Gerblins!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah, okay great. Listen—

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Who are you?! What are you doin’ in my home?!

speaker: Travis
lines: I wanna do an intimidation check.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Shut the fuck up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, roll. You gotta roll it, you can’t just say a lewd word. [Dice roll]

speaker: Justin
lines: He should say it, though, it’s good to know what kind of intimidation check we’re dealing with.

speaker: Travis
lines: Fifteen, plus five, it’s a 20.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Okay!

speaker: Magnus
lines: …Look me in the eye, Cassidy.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Here comes my peepers, put ‘em right on me.

speaker: Magnus
lines: We’ve been down in the quarry.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Wha?

speaker: Magnus
lines: We’ve seen the traps in the lockers. We’ve seen the smoke that eats flesh—

speaker: Cassidy
lines: [Overlapping] What are you talking about, traps in the lockers?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I think you know exactly what we’re talking about.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Better not be in my locker!

speaker: Magnus
lines: You buried a cluster bomb underneath some brush outside the quarry, am I right?

speaker: Cassidy
lines: I did do that, that one is on me.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Because you wanted to get back into the quarry.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: To find something out, right?

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Hey, who are you?

speaker: Magnus
lines: That doesn’t matter right now, Cassidy. What matters is that you tell us the truth.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: I ain’t telling you shit! I don’t know you from Jake! From Statefarm!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re gonna have to come up with some way of convincing her to tell you. You can’t just Batman growl at her and expect the truth.

speaker: Clint
lines: I have another suggestion. I cast Zone of Truth!

speaker: Justin
lines: Hell yeah you do!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. She has to roll a wisdom saving throw.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughing] Scooby-o-bop-diddy-o-bob!

speaker: Justin
lines: Super Effective!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That was actually a 14? Does that…

speaker: Clint
lines: Nope! Not enough.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Trust me.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you’re right. I think it’s eight plus your spellcasting modifier, so that won’t do it.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Okay! I feel compelled to now tell you my story of the quarry. My quarry story, is what I call it! [Travis laughs] I don’t call it that, I’ve never told my quarry story— why would I need a catchy name for the quarry story?

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Crosstalk] Okay. Just go ahead and do that, please.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: So, yeah, the mine went dead a few months ago, we lost the motherlode. So I was part of a small team of people that were working down there just trying to find a new vein of diamonds to try and keep Refuge alive. Try to save up some diamonds so when the bubble comes down we can all have fat stacks and retire rich!

speaker: So I was down there with a small team of my dedicated buddies and we were digging too deep. And, um, we found something down there. Down by where the edge of the bubble was. We found, like, a nest. A big nest, had this big nasty worm in it. The nest looked like it had been cut in half by the bubble, looked like it had been somehow— got cut up.

And then the momma, that big worm, that big nasty worm, it woke up. And, it killed my friends, and I managed to get out. And as I was getting out I saw something happen to it where it just kinda got stopped, kinda got stuck. Then I hit my head on a big rock! Woke up here in jail. ‘S the damndest thing.
Magnus
lines: And you didn’t see anyone on your way out? There wasn’t anyone else in the mine?

speaker: Cassidy
lines: I noticed some sort of, this is gonna sound stupid but like, just a shadow? Of a man? And I saw it, and he had his hands up, and honestly that’s what spooked me and I ran and bumped my head and ended up here in this jail. And they said I blew up the temple, that’s just crazy talk, that ain’t true. That never happened. Try again!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Wait, what about the temple?

speaker: Cassidy
lines: They said I— that’s what I’m in here for, they accused me of blowing up the temple. ‘Cause I’m, I mean, that is sort of my character, I blow up shit like all the time. I’m the best there is or ever was at it. So when something gets blowed up, like, everybody turns to ol’ Cassidy. But to me I think that’s racism? I never, I don’t know what that is—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay, great great great, what is, what’s the deal with the temple? What is the temple?

speaker: Cassidy
lines: I guess it got blowed up, I haven’t had a chance to get out of here and—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool, before it got blowed up, Cassidy. Like, what was it?

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughs] The non-blown up version of the temple.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Pre-blown up.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: Oh, yeah, it was just a lil, it was kind of a small temple, it was opened up by these two bros, and it was like all about— it was to a god named Istus? Is what they said, Istus, maybe Christmas? Isthmus? Bis— Biscuits?

speaker: Magnus
lines: That was probably it.

speaker: Merle
lines: Ooh, biscuits.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Um, Cassidy, where would I find Isaak, off the top— if you had to guess. Where’s he hang out?

speaker: Cassidy
lines: I don’t know, man. I would say here, this is like, his house, I guess? Naw, that doesn’t make sense, this’s his workplace. Damn it, Cassidy.

speaker: Clint
lines: Could you work a “Land o’ Goshen” in there somewhere?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Clint
lines: Just for me.

speaker: Travis
lines: Or a “by gum”.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, yeah.

speaker: Cassidy
lines: I don’t buy gum, I rent! [Travis laughs] I’m having fun with you gerblins.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Okay bye!

speaker: Travis
lines: Real quick, before you hop over to Taako, can I with my Lens of Straight Creeping see Isaak-y footprints anywhere? Or anything? From the sheriff's office?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No. You don’t, no. I don’t even know if that’s how the Lens of Straight Creeping works. But no.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s not, but you know, we make up the rules. There’s no rules in D&D.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Taako, are you going to Paloma?

speaker: Justin
lines: Is there a shop in town?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There is, there’s Helpington’s.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I should just go to Paloma’s. ‘Cause nothing I buy is gonna stick anyway.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s up to you, dawg.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I’m going to Paloma.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you go to Paloma’s hut in the woods, and you knock on the door and you hear,

speaker: Paloma
lines: Come iiin!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m gonna try to really nail this accent down this time, ‘cause I listened to that last episode and I was embarrassed.

speaker: Justin
lines: Just wrangle that bad boy into the ground.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Crosstalk] Is that the Bork voice?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yes, and then— so you come inside, and there’s Paloma, and—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait— hold on. You know her name’s not “Bork”, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: What?

speaker: Clint
lines: Is it Ba-jork?

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing] It’s not “Bork”.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh god, okay, see, I just agreed to what dad said without really processing what it was that he said [Clint Yeah!], and what he said was the name “Björk” as “Bork”.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well– yeah. You gotta watch that shit, Griffin!

speaker: Justin
lines: Bork! [Still dying]

speaker: Griffin
lines: I was almost an accomplice in that heinous act.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, maybe I was thinking of former Chief Justice Bork, did you ever think of that?

speaker: Justin
lines: Bork! [Giggles] Okay— [Giggles more]

speaker: Travis
lines: Bork is the only nameplate that Björk can find at like, tourist-y places.

speaker: Justin
lines: [imitating Björk] “Can you believe that someone already got B-J-O-R-K, is who I am, Björk. It is on a sedan, lifted by four gooses. There’s a plate that says Björk— Bork— very embarrassing.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, Taako, you see Paloma, and she looks you over, and says,

speaker: Paloma
lines: We met already, yes?

speaker: Taako
lines: We did, actually, yeah— good to see you again.

speaker: Paloma
lines: We can skip the niceties, it seems like you’re in a hurry.

speaker: Taako
lines: Listen, skipping niceties is our speciality.

speaker: Paloma
lines: What do you need? Big, small, prophecy; tell me, what?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, let’s make this a little bit easier, and retcon, and say that Ren gave you two diamonds, so you have 11, ‘cause I don’t think it makes much sense for you to have ten and have to pick and choose.

speaker: Taako
lines: Uh— you know what, I’m gonna treat myself. To both.

speaker: Paloma
lines: Which first?

speaker: Taako
lines: Ah, let’s go big.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says,

speaker: Paloma
lines: Okay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —and takes the diamonds, and sits you down at the table. She says,

speaker: Paloma
lines: Do you need a— would you like a treat? I just popped out a cranberry scone from the oven, it tastes so good, and it’s creamy, and berry-y-y [drawn out]—

speaker: Taako
lines: Bork, you know I’m gonna eat a cranberry scone.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She slides a plate across the table to you, and it’s a fucking… good scone, dawg!

speaker: Taako
lines: Uh, you know what, I like here, I can see here at the bottom, you’ve got the bake on this perfectly right, this is hard to nail exactly without burning the outside, still keeping some of the interior softness. Did you use a cold butter and, uh, cut it up? Or did you go room  temperature?

speaker: Paloma
lines: I— mostly just scone magic!

speaker: Taako
lines: [Disappointed] Oh. Okay. Well, this isn’t quite the in-depth cooking conversation I was hoping to have.

speaker: Travis
lines: Don’t eat that, Taako.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Don’t eat that, Taako, that’s a bad bake, Taako. No, it’s a good bake. Okay, yeah. She sits you down and while you nibble away at this scone—

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m not nibbling away. As near as I can tell, this is the first time I’ve eaten in two years.

speaker: Justin
lines: There is no nibbling to be done. Travis got to eat a magic stone, I think, once.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I’m all full up for the next two years.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay, while you’re devouring this scone, one of the bigger crystal teardrops on the ceiling sort of naturally unties itself from the string holding it to the ceiling, and it falls, and it shatters on the table, and this cloud of smoke appears, and it’s actually a much bigger production than the first small prophecy you got— I guess, a couple episodes now— from Paloma, and in this cloud, it looks like it’s a movie being shot in first person, and all you see are tracks, like, almost like train tracks or something?

speaker: With a, like, light cast down on them and they’re just sorta flying towards you, and Paloma like looks up at this thing, and in this vision of the tracks, you see a two-way junction come up, and then the picture just kinda stops as soon as the cart hits that junction. And Paloma leans right into you, Taako, and grabs your face and squeezes your face-cheeks, your face-cheeks together, and gets really close, and says,
Paloma
lines: [Voice echoing] Turn right!

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says.

speaker: Paloma
lines: [Voice echoing, more urgent] Turn right!

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, I turn right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She gets really, like, nose-to-nose.

speaker: Paloma
lines: [Voice echoing, whispers] Turn right.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, I turn right.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, and that’s the big prophecy?

speaker: Justin
lines: You don’t hear any of this, shut your mouth.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] And the smoke dissipates.

speaker: Justin
lines: This is my prophecy, I earned it through lying.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The smoke dissipates, and she says

speaker: Paloma
lines: Sorry, I got kind of aggro there.

speaker: Taako
lines: It happens.

speaker: Paloma
lines: I don’t really control what happens when—

speaker: Griffin
lines: And, as she’s talking, a second big crystal unspools itself from the ceiling.

speaker: Taako
lines: Whaaat?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And this one looks different from the first one. All the others ones here are kind of clear, with like, a little bit of illumination inside of them; this crystal is—

speaker: [“Big Prophecy” begins playing in the background]
Travis
lines: But this one has a beard.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This one is, like, pitch black inside, save for these strands of bright red and yellow and green, they’re just flashing around on the inside. And she looks up as she sees this crystal start to lower, and says,

speaker: Paloma
lines: Oh my god, what?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And it falls and shatters on the ground, and you see two side-by-side visions in this black cloud that appears as it shatters on the table. The first one just looks like an ocean made out of tar, with a black sky above it, and this tar is, like, bubbling, and you see some stuff moving under the surface of the tar, but you can’t make out what it is, and that’s on the left picture. And the one on the right is just a grey world, covered in, like, ash, that is just completely barren and lifeless.

speaker: And Paloma looks up over this black cloud, and she looks like completely— when she’s done her other prophecies, it kinda looked like she was having this out-of-body experience. Now it looks like she is just a baker possessed. And she says, in this deep voice, she says,
Paloma
lines: [Voice echoing] In the future, you will be offered a terrible choice between two options that will determine the fate of reality itself. In this moment of crisis, remember there is always a third option.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then the smoke dissipates, and it’s gone. And she slumps back in her chair. And she looks kinda winded. And I think she just kinda silently reaches over and fishes a scone out of a little bowl, and starts to nibble on it.

speaker: Taako
lines: One more time?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The prophecy?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, could you just do it again? I spaced.

speaker: Paloma
lines: I can’t do it again, what are you talking about? That almost killed me, that was horrible! I can’t just do it again, there was just the one crystal and it fell and broke! Were you not paying attention?

speaker: Taako
lines: Now, I have a question for you, interesting question. If we were to die, god forbid, and — or Pan forbid, I guess — if we were to die and come back tomorrow, would that crystal be fixed?

speaker: Paloma
lines: What are you talking about? “Die and come back tomorrow”? Yes, I guess so. I don’t know, that’s— again— that’s kind of a weird hypothetical, Taako.

speaker: Taako
lines: It’s a little bit esoteric. Hey, listen, let me get that small prophecy from you, if you still got some juice in them old bones.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says,

speaker: Paloma
lines: Oh yeah, small prophecy is easy. I burp and a small prophecy happen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She snaps her fingers, and a small crystal falls down and shatters, and she says,

speaker: Paloma
lines: [Voice echoing] You are close to your goal. But you are missing what you need to break the barrier.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says,

speaker: Paloma
lines: [Voice echoing] You will need divine intervention. You will find it at the Temple of Istus.

speaker: Taako
lines: Alright!
42-4113 commercial break}

speaker: Griffin
lines: Do you guys want to regroup?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah. I think we should regroup at the, at the temple.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Woop-woop-woop-woop-woop-woop! [Time travel noise]

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s about 1130 at this point, so the earthquake happens while you all meet up back in town. And while you meet up, I think you walk past Roswell, and Roswell’s like,

speaker: Roswell
lines: When are you guys supposed to go to the quarry? You told me to wait here and you would go to the quarry. What’s going on? What’s with the plan?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Alright, listen. We’ve been to the quarry. There’s a big bad down there.

speaker: Roswell
lines: What are you talking about?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I need you to find Isaak.

speaker: Roswell
lines: You’re giving me a lot of mixed messages right now, because you told me to wait here because the bank was going to get robbed. And then you— now you’re telling me to leave the bank?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yes. Get everyone out of the bank, tell them they’re closed for the day. Tell them it’s a bank holiday, it’s… Happy Hug Day, or whatever, and go find Isaak and meet us at the Temple.

speaker: Roswell
lines: It is Hug Day. It is Hug Day, so I don’t, like— we have our own sort of holidays that we made up because we’ve been in this bubble for a while, and Hug Day is one of them. So yeah, that tracks.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roswell says. And says,

speaker: Roswell
lines: Okay, uh, I’ll— what should I do when I find him, bring him back here? What do you want me to do?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Bring him to the temple. Meet us at the temple in twenty minutes.

speaker: Roswell
lines: Okay. Sounds good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Roswell runs off, probably towards— back towards the sheriff’s office, and you make your way up to the temple. So this involves a little climb. There’s, like, a small ramp, almost like the ramp you took down into the quarry, that leads up to this plateau, and once you’re up there, you can overlook all of Refuge, and you can really see, like, how fairly small this little village is.

speaker: And you can really see the big patch of woods behind the elder’s house that leads back to what looks like a small little bit of almost like an orchard. That, uh, it looks like it has also been vivisected by this bubble, and there’s only a small portion that remains in the town. And behind you, on the plateau, is what remains of this temple.
Um, which I will describe as soon as I find that part of my notes. Y’all are doing shit like, wildly out of order at this point, and I love it, but it is very hard to keep straight. Um—
Justin
lines: Okay, okay, point of order, you just had an old lady tell me to come here, so like, you’re gonna have to [Griffin Yeah.] —take some ownership of this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So this temple, that Cassidy has been accused of destroying by— of exploding, it’s definitely fallen. And what is left of this temple tells a story of its former glory.

speaker: It looks like an old, like, California Mission-style church, with terracotta walls that comprised a single large sanctuary space, with massive double doors that overlook the town. Um, Magnus, you’re kinda picking out these architectural details, despite the fact that—
Magnus
lines: Look at the joists!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —yeah, despite the fact that most of this building is on the ground, like you can see the space where this massive sanctuary was. The doorframe is still standing, but like very little of the building is. Uh, you can see at the front of the temple, over this teetering doorframe, you can see that there’s some wooden framing that would’ve supported this steeple that has collapsed through the side of the building. That steeple has a circular indentation, that used to hold a clock face, that’s currently laying on the ground.

speaker: You’re assuming it’s a clock face. The numbers on it have almost completely worn off; the only signs of its, like, former function are these clock hands which— they're rusted to hell, but they look like they were, at one point, these beautiful, intricately woven, sharp-looking hands of the clock. So it’s just like every part of this temple is on the ground, and just beat to hell.
Magnus
lines: Um, Merle? Do you know anything about Istus?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Merle about to make his first religion check.

speaker: Merle
lines: I know Istus of Panama!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Cool.

speaker: Merle
lines: [Sighs audibly] Uh… Yeah, I’ll make a religion check.

speaker: Travis
lines: Look out. Stand back!

speaker: Merle
lines: [Unintelligible] —my religion. What do I— what do I do?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You have a skill that’s called religion.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Roll.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You just roll a d20.

speaker: Clint
lines: All right! Here we go! [Dice roll] Thirteen! Plus three, for religion. Sixteen!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, yes. Istus— you recognise the name, it’s a fairly— it is a less trafficked goddess, she’s not so— like, not a lot of people are worshipping Istus, but she is called the Lady of Fate, um, in most circles. And she’s represented by a woman who kinda moves between these different ages, and is sort of, in summary, sort of thought of as, like, the keeper of fate and time.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m impressed with the amount of knowledge I have about this entity.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. You also notice a—

speaker: Clint
lines: How the— how did I spell her name?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I-S-T-U-S.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s what I thought.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You also recognise a sigil on this doorframe, that, again, is really super tarnished, but you make it out to be the sigil of Istus.

speaker: Travis
lines: And Ditto, is it so collapsed that we can’t get into it? Or—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, you can walk over— you can step over the wall and get into it, there’s just like not really a lot there to get into, you know what I mean? You can see like the floorboards. Like, you can step over those and be in the building, but it’s like, most of it has just completely collapsed.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, well, I’m gonna do an investigation check, I guess, and see if there’s anything important here.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay!

speaker: Travis
lines: [Dice roll] Uh, so 16, plus… nothing, so 16.

speaker: Griffin
lines: With that investigation check, you don’t see any signs of life. There haven’t— there hasn’t been anybody here in this building for what looks like a thousand years. And with that investigation check I will also tell you, you don’t see like scorch marks. You don’t see— nothing has been like shattered and broken, it’s just kind of… fallen apart? So, you don’t see signs of an explosion, which is weird considering Cassidy is in jail presumably because she blew up this temple. You don’t see any signs of, like, a bomb going off or an explosion or anything.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is there anything else about the clock? Like, where are the hands pointed?

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is a good question, I think the hands— I mean, it’s some innocuous time like 715 am.

speaker: Clint
lines: Don’t I have something where I can call on a deity? Or is it just my deity?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think it’s just yours.

speaker: Clint
lines: Poop.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t think you have a cell phone, like, you can call up Istus—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Dial up noise] Beep beep boop boop.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —and she’ll be like, “New phone who dis?”

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, I have an idea.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay.

speaker: Travis
lines: I would like to step into the middle of the ruins.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I would like to close my eyes and quietly say a prayer to Istus to guide our fate.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um—

speaker: Clint
lines: Ain’t that kinda my gig?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I would say that maybe you should let, uh, the priest do that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Why don’t you all do a quick group prayer?

speaker: Travis & Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just hold h—

speaker: Clint
lines: Can we hold hands?

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Can we hold hands?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, perfect.

speaker: Clint
lines: Just like church camp.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Singing to the tune of “Our God Is an Awesome God”] Our God is an Istus God!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay.

speaker: Merle
lines: [Out of character voice] O Holy Istus, hear the plea of us—

speaker: Justin
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Merle
lines: —your earth-bound servants, as we try to keep all hell from breaking loose in this lovely town… that’s kinda shitty looking.

speaker: Taako
lines: And please cure my friend’s voice, so that he sounds —

speaker: Merle
lines: [Crosstalk] [in character voice] And then beam down upon us—

speaker: Magnus
lines: It’s a miracle!

speaker: Merle
lines: —your fate, your fate-changing beams of power and just [choked up, emotional] love us and let us love each other. Amen.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] God, that was powerful!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um… A… Nothing happens.

speaker: Clint
lines: Shit!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then there’s this, uh, a breeze that comes through, and it’s a nice, soothing breeze. Again, it’s kinda sticky here, very humid. Your shorts are helping out some with that, but it’s just a sticky place. But a breeze comes through, and it feels nice, and it blows some of the dust up from the floor, and [clicks tongue] a… a small, white piece of cloth, that looks like it just kinda rotted off one of the curtains that are laying on the ground, starts to get blown around in this wind and you see it just start to float effortlessly on this wind away from this church, and you see it blow up and to the northwest a little bit, towards, you can see in the distance like it’s flying towards the cave.

speaker: Travis
lines: I follow it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just Forrest Gump style?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yup.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Singing beginning of “Flight to Neverland” by John Williams, which sounds similar to the theme from Forrest Gump by Alan Silvestri] doo-doo doo-doo doo-doo-di-doo-di- oh that’s Hook.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Exaggerated Jennie Curran voice] Run, Magnus, Run!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, are you all going to the cave?

speaker: Justin
lines: Probably, yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: Not as fast as Magnus, but—

speaker: Justin
lines: [Crosstalk] Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. I do love Magnus chasing things, that’s like one of my favorite things from this game, and now you’re just chasing a rag that is flying through the air. [Justin laughs]

speaker: Travis
lines: And I wanna— I wanna be clear I’m doing it full on like kid-trying-to-catch-a-butterfly style, you know, like, I’m just arms akimbo, running, so happy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Giggling, yeah. Uh, okay, yeah. [Justin laughs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: You make your way north, uh, to this cave, which is also up on the plateau. It is tucked away into like this outcropping, almost like a second plateau on top of this plateau, that is fairly large, uh, and ends at the bubble.

speaker: And you go in this cave entrance, and you go through a bit of tunnel. What’s your, like, what’s your method of approach? I should ask that whenever you go into like a building or a new situation.
Travis
lines: I think you know.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just like barreling?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Um—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughs] It’s a thing!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You—

speaker: Clint
lines: We have kind of established the dynamic of him barreling in, me trying to make him stop, and Taako hanging back.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Well, then Magnus, I guess you’re the first one to see, but all you boys see, there’s like a slight curve in the entrance of this cave after you go through a short tunnel. You see lantern light kind of flashing off the walls on the inside of this cave.

speaker: And you see what looks like the shadow of a guy reading a book in this lantern light, and as you come like barreling tactlessly into this cave, you see this shadow move really quick, like, look to the side and then throw the book down, and then the lantern light goes out.
Magnus
lines: Hello?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, there’s no response.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Now don’t be like that. [Griffin chuckles] I’m sorry I caught you reading. I won’t make fun of you, I promise.

speaker: Clint
lines: He wasn’t sitting on a toilet, was he?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, no.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Crosstalk] Ooh, hate to see that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, there’s no, uh, there’s still no response.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Aziz, light!

speaker: Griffin
lines: What?

speaker: Travis
lines: I was— It’s from Fifth Element. Dad, could you make some—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Holy shit, dawg!

speaker: Travis
lines: There’s like one person who went crazy when I said that. Um, dad—

speaker: Travis
lines: —could you make some light? Or Taako, I can’t see.

speaker: Clint
lines: I certainly can, all I have to do is touch one object that is no larger than ten feet in any dimension, and that object will shed light in a 20-foot radius—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] The human spell library, Clint McElroy.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s right.

speaker: Justin
lines: What are you touching?

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m going to—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing] My butt!

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m going to — I think it would look really cool — I’m going to touch the amulet around my neck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: And it’ll beam light forward.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: Like Doctor Strange.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You touch your joke amulet [pronounced with a long a sound, like “om-ulet”], and it illuminates! And you can see, uh — I’m assuming you’ve moved a little further into the cave — you see this small chamber, that the cave kind of dead ends into. And there’s some, uh, there’s a couple barrels in this chamber, there’s a cart in this chamber with a couple boxes on it, one of the barrels has a lantern on it, and then laying on a rug, sort of—

speaker: Justin
lines: So wait, we needed the light to see the lantern?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The lantern got turned off.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And in the midst of this little scene, at the back wall of this little chamber there’s a rug, and there’s a book laying on the rug, that is actually open and faced down like it was just thrown down, and with its back up against the wall, there is a skeleton.

speaker: The skeleton is wearing a sort of brown sackcloth robe, and it has— it is also wearing an amulet [still pronouncing it “om-ulet”], and Merle, you recognise that amulet, it’s also the sigil of Istus. And this—
Travis
lines: Why do you keep saying “omulet”? Like an omelet amulet.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean—

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughing] Because it looks— that’s what it’s made out of.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it’s an egg necklace. And—

speaker: Travis
lines: He got it at the magical store of Denny’s.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And this skeleton has another interesting thing about it, and that is, its skull has been, like, painted? In bright yellows and purples and green segments, almost like a Día de los Muertos mask, to help sort of give you an idea of the aesthetic. Its skull has been intricately and beautifully painted. But it is just laying down. Uh, with its back up against the wall.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hmm.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is it… alive?

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, it’s a skeleton. [Clint laughs]

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, yeah but we’re like, in D&D, where there’s like centaurs and ghosts and shit. So like—

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s good— it’s a fair point.

speaker: Travis
lines: Skeletons move around and sometimes you gotta fight ‘em.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hey, Griffin, is the chair alive?

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s D&D, y’know, I don’t really think—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, by the way, when you came into this cave you heard the explosion behind you from the bank.

speaker: Justin
lines: Aw dunk.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just to give you—

speaker: Clint
lines: [Urgently] What time is it?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, it’s getting— it’s getting there.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Splutters for a second] I re— I read the book!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh—

speaker: Clint
lines: I grab the book and read it!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The book is like — oh, shit, let’s tie it all together — the book is not some religious text, it’s a Caleb Cleveland Kid Cop novel. [Justin laughs]

speaker: Travis
lines: [Quietly] I see.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s from like, it’s one of the later ones, which aren’t as good, uh, because he’s a teen cop.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] And it’s like, what’s the point?

speaker: Griffin
lines: What’s the fucking point?

speaker: Clint
lines: Isn’t… [Pause] No, no, I’m thinking of something else.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna check out the skeleton?

speaker: Justin
lines: [Voice cracks] Wait a minute— those are Angus’s favorite books, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, they’re— they’re a very, very popular book series.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Softly, with great feeling] Oh my god. The skeleton is Angus.

speaker: Travis
lines: Noooo! Only now do I miss him!

speaker: Clint
lines: [In the background] Yay! Yaaay!

speaker: Justin
lines: Nobody saw this coming, how did he get here?!

speaker: Travis
lines: Um, I’m gonna check out that skellington.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mmkay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hey, where is Angus? Didn’t he come with us?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Naw.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s what I was—

speaker: Justin
lines: No? Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That was the live episode that we did.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Like he remembers] That was the live episode, yeah yeah yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: [At the same time as Clint] Oh that’s right, okay okay okay okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Things got really conflated, ‘cause we did two episodes two nights in a row. But no, Angus is not with you. And in fact I should point out, since you’ve been in this town, your Stones of Far Speech are not— you have not had any messages from anybody at the Bureau on your Stones. They are just completely dead silent.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, we knew that, that’s why we hadn’t checked them, we figured—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] Yeah, sure.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Crosstalk] Yeah, we knew.

speaker: Clint
lines: Pssh, come on, man.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, hold on— there’s a rug in the cave?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Like it should have been obvious] I’m gonna look under the rug.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You find a trap door to— no, there’s nothing under the rug.

speaker: Travis
lines: Fuck.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um—

speaker: Justin
lines: Does it bite him ‘cause it’s alive?

speaker: [Clint does a laugh-wheeze, Justin starts giggling]
Travis
lines: [Indignantly] Skeletons! Move! In this game! And sometimes you have to fight them! I’m not making this up, Justin, I don’t want to f— [Sighs]

speaker: Justin
lines: Carpets can fly, read your Aladdin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: Suck my butt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —what are you doing?

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m checking out the skellington.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, how are you doing that?

speaker: Travis
lines: Are there any pockets in the robe, what’s the deal with the amulet…?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, we’ll say— as you— yeah, there’s pockets in the robe.

speaker: Travis
lines: I find some receipts. [Justin laughs]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you reach into the pock—

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] Whoa!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —you reach into the pocket, and as you do, the skeleton, you can’t tell if you just like disrupted it and knocked it over, but it moves, and you hear like a, [makes a disgruntled noise] “ergh”.

speaker: Travis
lines: See?!

speaker: Clint
lines: I have a spell to cast.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh-oh. [Griffin laughs] I hope that— I hope that skeleton’s ready to spill its secrets.

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s called Resurrection.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Whispers] Oh shit.

speaker: Clint
lines: I touch a dead creature that has been dead for no more than a century, its soul is free and willing the target returns to life… Yeah! It restores life to a creature.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Does this spell take, like, an hour to cast? ‘Cause this seems like the kind of spell that takes, like, an hour to cast, otherwise, if you can just instantly bring back any dead person to life it may reduce the narrative stakes of The Adventure Zone podcast a bit.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, it’s— it’s seventh level… Necromancy.

speaker: [Long burst of hysterical laughter from Justin]
Clint
lines: Why are you laughing?

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] Cause you're, you— you're like level eight, or something!

speaker: Clint
lines: I also have—

speaker: Travis
lines: And you're also not a necromancer.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Crosstalk] Not in any way, shape, or form!

speaker: Clint
lines: I also have Matthias.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Crosstalk] It also takes— it does take one hour to cast.

speaker: Clint
lines: Fine.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, wait, what's Matthias?

speaker: Clint
lines: No, no no! No, go ahead! Have your fun!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You understand why I can't allow you to like, instantly bring any dead person back to life, no matter what.

speaker: Clint
lines: Even if I'm using a spell I don't know?

speaker: Justin
lines: And don't have—

speaker: Griffin
lines: And don't have it, and can't have—

speaker: Justin
lines: It'll never happen.

speaker: Clint
lines: Even though I can use a spell I don't know, because I have Matthias, the Living Grimoire?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ohhh.

speaker: Travis
lines: That doesn't make it not an hour.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you still c— yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Sighs] Fine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You don't have a magic owl. You don't have a resurrection owl that can bring back any dead person from life.

speaker: Clint
lines: I have an owl that lets me use a spell I don't know!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That's fair, that's cheating. Damn it. You've cheated the system again. What are you doing with the skeleton?

speaker: Clint
lines: No, that's fine. If it's gonna cut, I don't have time!

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, so here's the thing. Something was in this room and moved, right? And dropped the book and turned off the lamp. There's no other exit to this room.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, I grab the skeleton and shake it and say,

speaker: Taako
lines: Give us your secrets!

speaker: Skeleton
lines: Okay, stop, stop, stop, stop, stop, stop.

speaker: Travis
lines: See? Suck my butt, Justin!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Was that in universe?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Suck my butt, Taako!

speaker: Skeleton
lines: Unhand me, please.

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, sure, no problem.

speaker: Clint
lines: Can you make it a little bonier?

speaker: Skeleton
lines: [More nasal and high pitched] Unhand me, please!

speaker: Skeleton
lines: What do you hooligans want? You’ve come into my little hutch here. I was enjoying a good Cleveland tale, and he just broke the big case! And you randos rolled up on my spot!

speaker: Merle
lines: And what is your name?

speaker: Skeleton
lines: That— what is your name, hooligan?

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m sorry. [In character voice] What is your name?

speaker: Skeleton
lines: [Exaggerated] What is your name, hooligan?

speaker: Merle
lines: I’m Merle the hooligan.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I’m Magnus the hooligan.

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m Taako. You’re alive, I don’t believe it, uh, there’s egg on my face, you don’t know how big of a— I guess you are, you heard the whole thing.

speaker: Skeleton
lines: I did! You really ding-donged this one up!

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, I stepped in it. Good news is I'll be dead soon.

speaker: Skeleton
lines: What do you mean?

speaker: Merle
lines: So, tell us your name!

speaker: Skeleton
lines: My name is Luca!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Are you of the temple Istus?

speaker: Luca
lines: I am the chief cleric of the temple Istus! Not that— I mean, not so much anymore, but yeah! That's me, alright!

speaker: Merle
lines: So your name is Luca.

speaker: Luca
lines: Are you about to do a joke about the song Luka?

speaker: Merle
lines: [Hesitates] No.

speaker: Merle
lines: Not now!

speaker: Luca
lines: [Crosstalk] No, go, please go ahead, I live on the second floor.

speaker: Merle
lines: Forget it. Forget it.

speaker: Luca
lines: No, what floor do I live on, Merle, tell me.

speaker: Merle
lines: Nobody wants my input this week! Fine, fine, fine.

speaker: Taako
lines: I mean, you literally live in a cave underneath a pile of rocks.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Are you one of the brothers?

speaker: Luca
lines: How do you know about that?

speaker: Magnus
lines: I heard about it in town?

speaker: Justin
lines: Well that’s— that’s not true.

speaker: Travis
lines: That is true! Cassidy told us about it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh okay, sorry, I was getting my prophecy confused with your horseshit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: By the way, Luca is talking like, not moving a whole lot. Like his mouth is moving up and down almost imperceptibly when he talks. But he says,

speaker: Luca
lines: Yes, I— My brother and I came to this town together. What— what are you doing here; why did you come looking for me? How did you find me?

speaker: Magnus
lines: We’re, uh, we’re investigating the bubble, and a chalice, and a big worm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I debated about this, because you’ve talked about looking for a thing and people were like “Why wasn’t that staticked out?”, but I think if you just reference a chalice it’s not—

speaker: Travis
lines: A chalice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —it’s not staticked.

speaker: Travis
lines: Lowercase c.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Luca
lines: You’re here to stop the bubble? Here to stop what’s going on in this town?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yes.

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Crosstalk] [drawn out] Yes?

speaker: Taako
lines: Yes, we are.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Luca
lines: Okay, I like where you’re coming from, I would also very much like to stop what’s happening in this town. You guys understand that time is, like. Time is sick in Refuge, right?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, we’ve gathered.

speaker: Luca
lines: It kinda goes against everything we do in the church of Istus. We celebrate the normal passage of time, and that is— anything but that is happening here in Refuge. What do you need? How can I help you?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Like, any information?

speaker: Luca
lines: I was in the— I was in the temple just doing my prayers, doing my scribing and such, counting the offerings, when it just… Something happened. And everything inside the temple aged very quickly.

speaker: And luckily I was the only person inside, and none of my— none of the followers of Istus were harmed, but I— that’s how I ended up in this sorry state, and how the temple ended up in its sorry state. I don’t know what did it, but I suspect it’s the same thing that’s causing everything to be all screwy in this town.
Justin
lines: I’m gonna ask that Merle take over questioning, because he is a man of the cloth as well and I feel like he might be able to get a little further. We don’t have a lot of time.

speaker: Merle
lines: Okay! So, explain one thing to me. I know it’s D&D and everything, but how the hell are—

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, so you wanted us to save time by putting dad in charge.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, let him finish!

speaker: Merle
lines: How are you talking?

speaker: Luca
lines: That is an excellent question that I’m not entirely sure of myself. I’m— oh, I assume it is only by the grace of Istus herself that I am allowed to continue to function in this… goofy ass town, but, uh, I’m not a hundred percent sure! I’m not complaining though, although it is— I haven’t really interfaced with anybody else in town since I’ve entered this sorry state. It’s, as you can imagine, pretty upsetting to see a living skeleton man!

speaker: Magnus
lines: Merle, ask him about his brother.

speaker: Merle
lines: Hey! How ‘bout them brothers?

speaker: Luca
lines: Are you a— like the idea of brothers in general? I guess it’s great!

speaker: Merle
lines: No, your brother!

speaker: Luca
lines: Two boys related with the same parents, I love it.

speaker: Merle
lines: Tell me about your brothers, my bony friend.

speaker: Luca
lines: I only have the one… brother, and I haven’t seen him—

speaker: Merle
lines: Aren’t we all brothers?

speaker: Luca
lines: In Istus, sure! I haven’t seen my brother, Redmond, in quite some time; he… [sigh] We came to this town together to start up the temple. And he went off into— let’s call it the private sector, and, uh, opened up his own farm here in town, that was very lucrative.

speaker: But he got kind of screwed when the bubble went up, and, well, I think he harbors quite a grudge about that. So he’s been trying to brute force his way out of town, and uh, I don’t know that that’s the way to go, I think we should rely on the grace of Istus, but, y’know, who am I to— I am not my brother’s keeper.
Merle
lines: Well, kinda.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Luca
lines: I would be willing to help you out, to help you… seek divine intervention from Istus herself. But I will need my brother’s help in order to do so. Can— can you please go find him? And talk to him and tell him that Luca misses him and needs his help.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Yeah. Probably not in this loop, but—

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says,

speaker: Luca
lines: What are you talking about, “this loop”?

speaker: Magnus
lines: [Crosstalk] Don’t— Yeah, really, don’t worry about that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And as you say that, you feel the tremors start again, from outside, and you hear the bells start to chime.

speaker: [The Clock Strikes Noon
lines: Apocalypse starts playing]

speaker: Luca
lines: What are you talking about, “this loop”?

speaker: Taako
lines: It’s— this has been so much fun.

speaker: Merle
lines: I’ve got it! I’ve got the solution to everything! I’ve know the answer to every question!

speaker: Travis
lines: Hey, I know the joke you’re setting up and it’s not gonna work cause we remember on the next loop.

speaker: Clint
lines: Aw, shit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. I think this time the— This supersonic explosion happens outside and I think the cave just collapses on all of you and Luca, and you get crushed by rocks.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ow! That, That hurts!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And when you come into the white space this time, the old woman is lying on the floor.

speaker: Taako
lines: [Quietly] Shit.

speaker: Travis
lines: I move to her.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you wake up.
